title: Capstone: Practice and Habit Formation
objective: Consolidate method into daily practice and habits for ongoing study

required_passages.text: Read as a model for sustained delight and meditation in Scripture over time.
Read as a framework for Scripture's formative role in lifelong training and ministry readiness.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson eighteen, the capstone. Plan daily habits to apply the method consistently.
Read Psalm 1:1-2 and 2 Timothy 3:16-17, then build a weekly habit plan for disciplined study.
Sustained practice turns skills into habits. Set realistic goals: short daily readings and weekly deeper study.
Track your exegetical steps and review past conclusions periodically. Habitual practice improves speed and accuracy.
Key outcome: lifelong skill developmentâ€”interpretation is a craft improved by disciplined practice.
What habit will you form this week to practice the method?
This completes Hermeneutics One. Continue practicing and consult resources for deeper study. Well done.

vocabulary.definition: Intentional regular practices that develop skill over time

study_notes: Create a simple tracker for observations and hypotheses to review progress.
